intro: Sabadilla caricifolia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has strap-shaped leaves and produces blue to purple flowers with a distinctive central yellow tuft. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Sabadilla caricifolia is also noted for its medicinal properties, although its use is limited due to its toxicity.
